column1: Sendhwa is a city with a municipal government in Barwani district in the Indian state of Madhya Pradesh. It is the headquarters for Sendhwa Tehsil.
Sendhwa is located at MH&MP Border 21.68°N 75.1°E﻿ / 21.68; 75.1. It has an average elevation of 409 metres (1341 feet).

column3: 485. Males constitute 52% of the population and females 48%. Sendhwa has an average literacy rate of 63%
column4: higher than the national average of 59.5%: male literacy is 70%
column5: and female literacy is 55%. In Sendhwa
column6: 17% of the population is under 6 years of age.
